bibl.title: Letter from Roswell P. Bishop to [Elihu Root], October 24, 1901

div1.p: Bishop requests, on behalf of Victor C. Vaughan, that Walter Reed be detailed to attend a medical conference at Ann Arbor, Michigan in order to present a paper on his yellow fever research. A copy of Vaughan's letter of October 23, 1901 is enclosed. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Roswell P. Bishop to [Elihu Root], October 24, 1901
div1.opener:
ROSWELL P. BISHOP,
9th Michigan Dist.
Member of Committee on Rivers and Harbors
and Private Land Claims.
House of Representatives,
Washington, D.C.
Ludington, Mich., 10/ 24/ 1901.
Hon. Secretary of War,
Washington, D. C.
Dear sir:-
div1.p:
I have the honor to enclose herewith, a letter
from V. C. Vaughan, M. D., one of the professors of medicine
in the Michigan University. This letter fully expresses
his wishes. If consistent, I would be pleased to have you
grant the request of Dr. Vaughan, and allow the Major to
report at Ann Arbor, at the date of the meeting of the Health
Officers of the State of Michigan.
